mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: West Virginia History OnView and Storer College
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Engraving of John Storer of Sanford, Maine
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Ritchie, H. A.
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Soon after the Civil War, John Storer contributed $10,000 towards establishing a college in Harpers Ferry, W. Va. This institution of higher learning was the first college below the Mason- Dixon Line to accept students "without distinction of race or color". The school bears the name of it's principle benefactor, Storer College.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: African American college students
